subject: Gardening
title: Alhambra's Garden Courtyards
description: A quick win: understand Alhambra's Garden Courtyards.

hook.text: The Alhambra in Granada doesn't just have gardens. Its entire architecture is built around them.

buildup.text: Moorish architects designed palace rooms to frame garden views. Inside and outside merged seamlessly.

discovery.text: The Court of the Lions uses 124 marble columns around a central fountainâ€”geometry as spiritual expression.

twist.text: Water channels embedded in floors connected every room. The sound of flowing water was the building's heartbeat.

climax.text: The Alhambra proves that gardens aren't additions to architecture. They can be the architecture itself.

punchline.text: At the Alhambra, the garden is the building.

quiz.question: How did Moorish architects integrate gardens into the Alhambra's architecture?
options: They built glass ceilings over the garden spaces
They designed rooms to frame garden views with water channels connecting every space
They planted trees directly inside palace rooms
